alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; La Salle (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 11:40PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Caldwell, southeastern Jackson, northwestern La Salle, southern Ouachita and Winn Parishes through 1245 AM CDT... At 1139 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles southwest of Brownsville-Bawcomville to 10 miles northeast of Natchitoches. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winnfield, Columbia, Olla, Clarks, Grayson, Urania, Tullos, Dodson, Calvin, Atlanta, Sikes, Fondale, Spaulding, Vixen, Bosco, Hudson, Riverton, Standard, Kelly and Joyce. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana.
